title: Projects
text: I am currently working on my thesis, which investigates the roles of social determinants of health in liver disease outcomes and various stages of the liver transplant evaluation process. The goal of this research is to identify actionable insights to reduce health disparities and improve patient outcomes.

title: Projects
text:
Environmental Health and Sarcoidosis
Another project that I am working on is looking at the relationship between residential air pollution exposure and pulmonary sarcoidosis pathology. By leveraging geospatial techniques and analyzing explant patterns of disease, this work aims to uncover environmental risk factors that may influence disease progression.

title: Blog
text:
In his book, “How to be a Modern Scientist,” Jeffrey Leek discusses the current landscape of research and publication processes, which I found very helpful as someone in early stages of their academic career. An aspect of the book that I particularly appreciated and benefited from was the emphasis on making research highly accessible. This included steps from writing in a clear manner, submitting articles to pre-print sites, and adding published data sets to data repositories. After reading the practical steps included in the book, I am more inclined to use these resources and processes. While I was somewhat familiar with data repositories before as well, the idea that all published data should ideally be available or accessible in some way, along with the accompanying code used for analysis, was relatively new to me. All of this helps ensure that our work is reproducible.Finally, to make research findings even more accessible, the author discusses the use of social media. As a graduate student, I am just beginning to work on cultivating a social media presence. This is something that I have found more challenging, but I think it will be an important skill for me to learn going forward. Overall, reading and reflecting upon this book made me consider how I want to contribute to a research culture focused on transparency and collaboration, along with suggesting clear steps for putting these ideals into practice.

title: Welcome!
text:
Twitter
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     Email
  




Welcome!
My name is Kelly, and I’m a medical student with a passion for public health and research to address real-world health challenges. My current work focuses on studying social determinants of health in liver disease, with a goal of turning data into actionable solutions. Outside of academics, I enjoy finding balance through creative outlets, staying active, and spending time with my two cats. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions!
